alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 21 at 2:39PM MDT until March 22 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR THE EAST CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND DRY FUELS... .A deepening lee side trough combined with strong winds aloft and good mixing will lead to very windy conditions Wednesday, especially across the eastern plains. Above normal temperatures are forecast across the eastern plains, where the combination of dry fine fuels and strong winds may support the rapid spread of fire. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and the East Central Plains (Zone 126) from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 25 to 40 mph with gusts to near 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...17 to 23 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended..
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
